subSubSection.paragraph:
Siculodes nubecula Guenée, 1858
, in Boisduval & Guenée.
Annales de la Société Entomologique de France , Atlas
, plate 1, fig. 3 (male d); no data.— Guenée, 1877 .
Annales de la Société Entomologique de France , (5)
7: 301, syn. :
Iza nubecula
.— Pagenstecher, 1892 . Deutsche entomologische Zeitschrift “Iris”, 5 : 113.—Druce, 1895, in Godman & Salvin. Biologia Centrali-Americana: zoology, botany and archaeology 2 : 186.

Rhodoneura nubecula ;
Dalla Torre, 1914 . Lepidopterorum Catalogus 20 : 29.

Rhodoneura configurata
Gaede, 1936
, in
Seitz. Die Gross -Schmetterlinge des Amerikanischen Faunengebietes. Die
amerikanischen Spinner und Schwärmer 6: 1205, fig. 173f (female d); 1 female [holo] type , Brazil , [MSFR].

Taxonomic history .
Siculodes nubecula
was described with an illustration of the male. Guenée (1877) noted that the species occurs in Rio de Janeiro [ Brazil ] and that the specimen was deposited in his personal collection, and also that the species must be the type species of the genus
Iza
. Druce (1895) also referred to
I. nubecula
as the type species of the genus.

Rhodoneura configurata
was described and illustrated based on a female [holo] type ; synonymized with
I. nubecula
by Whalley & Heppner (1995) .

Type material .
Iza nubecula : Guenée (1858)
was described based on the male, but without specifying the number of specimens. Whalley (1964) mistakenly stated that the holotype is a female when in fact the syntype is a male deposited in the NHMUK . This syntype was found in the collection referred to by Whalley (1964) and includes the author’s original labels that correspond to the published description. To give stability to the proposed name and ensure the correct identification of the species, this syntype is herein designated as a lectotype , with the following labels: / Holotype / Type/ 4. S. Nubecula Gn pl. du Spec. 1 fig. 3.—Wlk 521. Sup. Rio jan. /
Siculodes nubecula
Rio Janeiro / Ex. Musaeo Ach. Guénée / Ex Oberth̹r Coll. Brit. Mus. 1927-3. / NHMUK 010921544 /, and the following labels will be added: / LECTOTYPE / LECTOTYPE
Siculodes nubecula Guenée, 1858
, Queiroz-Santos, Casagrande & Mielke 2020 /.

Rhodoneura configurata : Gaede (1936)
described the species based on a female [holo]type found in the MSFR , with the author’s original labels with information corresponding to the original description; the holotype bears the following labels: / Typus /
configurata
Type det. M. Gaede / Blumenau Sta. Catharina 25.XII.1929 . Ad. Friedrich S. / Senckenb. Mus. / 4 / Fotografiert 2014 H. Thöny. /

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–2 .
Hepialodes
and
Iza
species in dorsal (A and C) and ventral (B and D) views. 1 .
H. follicula
, A–B : male from Brazil, Rio de Janeiro, Itatiaia (MZUSP); C–D : female from Brazil, Pará (NHMUK 010921585). 2 .
I. nubecula
, A–B : male from Brazil, Bahia, Camacan (MWM); C–D : female from Brazil, Mato Grosso, Alto Paraguai (MWM 36.272). Scale bar 1cm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Natural history . Immature stages and host plant unknown. Based on label information the species occurs both in forest and cerrado and adults were caught from January to May, and November– December.
